content:
I'm messing around with the rust compiler, modifying some code and messing with stuff. Mostly just compiling default stage 1, I believe, ./x.py build library/std.

It seems like there's some setting that's causing the compile to error out on what would normally be a warning. For example if I remove the use of some method, it will error, associated function is never used. Is there some way to temporarily disable this pedantic compile setting so I can speed up my development?
